content.raw: Lovely, won't it crash anyway becuse of `gzthrow` in Camera::Load? Also, could you please mention exact condition when it crashes? Ordinary `Camera` works just fine with `hfov` over π (I mean it does't crash at creation, however the image is upside down).
content.html: Lovely, won't it crash anyway becuse of gzthrow in Camera::Load? Also, could you please mention exact condition when it crashes? Ordinary Camera works just fine with hfov over π (I mean it does't crash at creation, however the image is upside down).

content.raw: It's currently possible to tell the camera to use a field-of-view that is greater than PI when the rest of the configuration doesn't support such a wide angle. When this happens, OGRE crashes.
content.html: It's currently possible to tell the camera to use a field-of-view that is greater than PI when the rest of the configuration doesn't support such a wide angle. When this happens, OGRE crashes.

content.raw:
Where am I supposed to see the results of this?

1. Open the world with the plugin and click the spawn button, one camera comes up

1. Ctrl + T and choose to visualize the camera image, I can see the things I put in front of it

1. Select the camera, its name appears on the top of the GUI overlay

1. I change several values, including making the camera custom, increasing the FOV, scale/not scale... Nothing seems to change the image in the topic. Even if I reopen the topic window the image seems not to have changed.

Am I doing something wrong?
content.html:

  4. I change several values, including making the camera custom, increasing the FOV, scale/not scale... Nothing seems to change the image in the topic. Even if I reopen the topic window the image seems not to have changed.

content.raw:
related issue, #1561, but could be different problem - it's a memory leak found when using software rendering in VM

I'm using nvidia driver 346.46 and tested subscribing to an image topic in `worlds/camera.world`. The memory seemed to stay around the same for me and uses around 250MB. Using `valgrind` with memcheck indicated some warnings in transport when a connections are established but doesn't show signs of continuous memory leak. 

So maybe the video driver?
content.html:
related issue, #1561, but could be different problem - it's a memory leak found when using software rendering in VM

I'm using nvidia driver 346.46 and tested subscribing to an image topic in worlds/camera.world. The memory seemed to stay around the same for me and uses around 250MB. Using valgrind with memcheck indicated some warnings in transport when a connections are established but doesn't show signs of continuous memory leak.

So maybe the video driver?

content.raw: There is a nice bug here(maybe a feature?), when creating a new publisher an old one is still present, it's not destroyed because `Node::Advertise` stores it's shared pointer to some private array for as long as the `Node` is alive.
content.html: There is a nice bug here(maybe a feature?), when creating a new publisher an old one is still present, it's not destroyed because Node::Advertise stores it's shared pointer to some private array for as long as the Node is alive.

@chapulina, Issue #1763 This will welp with passing mouse events to 3d scene

diff -r a695c0eb9ae6 examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.cc
--- a/examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.cc  Fri Oct 09 22:10:55 2015 +0000
+++ b/examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.cc  Wed Oct 14 03:39:30 2015 +0300
@@ -52,6 +52,9 @@
   QWidget *contentWidget = loader.load(&file, this);
   file.close();

+  // Prevent mouse events propagation to parent widget
+  contentWidget->installEventFilter(this);
+
   // Add loaded widget to layout
   frameLayout->addWidget(contentWidget);

@@ -333,3 +336,22 @@
   this->sbC3->setEnabled(isCustom);
   this->sbF->setEnabled(isCustom);
 }
+
+/////////////////////////////////////////////////
+bool CameraLensControlExample::eventFilter(QObject *_watched, QEvent *_event)
+{
+  std::set<QEvent::Type> filtered = { QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick,
+                                      QEvent::MouseButtonPress,
+                                      QEvent::MouseButtonRelease,
+                                      QEvent::MouseMove,
+                                      QEvent::MouseTrackingChange };
+
+  if (filtered.find(_event->type()) != filtered.end())
+  {
+    return true;
+  }
+  else
+  {
+    return _watched->eventFilter(_watched, _event);
+  }
+}
diff -r a695c0eb9ae6 examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.hh
--- a/examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.hh  Fri Oct 09 22:10:55 2015 +0000
+++ b/examples/plugins/camera_lens_control/CameraLensControlExample.hh  Wed Oct 14 03:39:30 2015 +0300
@@ -37,6 +37,11 @@
     /// \brief Destructor
     public: virtual ~CameraLensControlExample();

+    /// \brief Filter mouse events, so that parent widget won't handle them
+    /// \param[in] _watched Receiver of the event
+    /// \param[in] _event Event to filter
+    private: bool eventFilter(QObject *_watched, QEvent *_event) override;
+
     /// \brief Load GUI components
     /// \param[in] _parent Pointer to the parent widget
     private: virtual void LoadGUIComponents(QWidget *_parent);
